title: Strengthening Clinical Practice Competencies: Foundational Approaches for Sustainable Architectural Design and Energy Efficiency Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: It can quantitatively analyze energy consumption patterns of buildings and HVAC systems

Within four weeks, learners will propose three improvements incorporating sustainability principles (e.g., passive design, renewable energy integration) for hospital facility design and submit a report quantitatively analyzing each improvement’s energy savings (%) or carbon emission reduction (kgCO₂/year).

Within two weeks, learners will derive at least one integrated problem-solving solution following the IPEC (Interprofessional Education Collaboration) framework by collaborating with professionals from other fields (e.g., social workers, physical therapists) based on three medical/nursing cases, and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on the team evaluation rubric (5-point scale: Communication, Collaboration, Creativity).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
